summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Correctional Systems Officer (S. ) regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and the surrounding circumstances at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 9-10, 2019. The interview focuses on inmate movement procedures, count verification, the removal of Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes, and discrepancies in inmate counts in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate until he was removed from MCC for court on August 9, 2019, and did not return.
The officer had knowledge of Epstein's situation through her work in R&D and custody, including awareness of his cellmate leaving.
Worked together during the midnight shift on August 10, 2019, with the Lieutenant taking counts while the officer worked Control.
Both were BOP staff working during the relevant period, with Noel being in the SHU.

events.title: Removal of Epstein's cellmate
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, was pre-removed from MCC at 8:38 a.m. for court and did not return, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

events.title: Inmate placed on dry cell watch
events.description: Inmate Fernandez was placed on dry cell watch in R&D at 3:15 p.m., but was not properly keyed out of the SHU, causing count discrepancies.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC, having died by suicide.

events.title: Count discrepancy discovered
events.description: Lieutenant discovered during the midnight count that the SHU count was off by one inmate (Fernandez) who was in R&D but still keyed to SHU.

events.title: OIG interview conducted
events.description: DOJ OIG Special Agents interviewed BOP Correctional Systems Officer S.  regarding Epstein's death and surrounding circumstances.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Road (MCC New York)
keyFacts: Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes was removed from MCC at 8:38 a.m. on August 9, 2019, for court and did not return, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.
There were significant count discrepancies in the SHU on August 9-10, 2019, with inmate Fernandez improperly tracked as being in SHU when he was actually in R&D on dry cell watch.

The witness stated that if staff knew an inmate was WAB (With All Belongings) and not returning, and knew Epstein required a cellmate, they should have taken immediate action to assign a new cellmate.
Camera coverage in the SHU was poor, with only a distant view of the multi-purpose area that didn't show individual cells clearly.
The witness believes Epstein took his own life and has no knowledge of anyone assisting him or causing his death.
